com.forana.please

Class HTTPRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.forana.please.HTTPRequest

  • public class HTTPRequest
extends java.lang.Object
    Object symbolizing an HTTP request. Supports builder-style population and chaining.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected HTTPRequest(java.lang.String method, java.lang.String url)
      Creates a new request with this specified method and URL.

      Add a JSON body to this request as an JsonNode.

      Add a multipart/form-data body to this request.

      Add an object as a body to this request.

      Provides the proper HttpUriRequest implementation for this request.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HTTPRequest

        protected HTTPRequest(java.lang.String method,
           java.lang.String url)
        Creates a new request with this specified method and URL. This should not be called directly from client code - instances of this class should be accessed from Please or HTTPRequestFactory.

    • Method Detail

      • header

        public HTTPRequest header(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String value)
        Add a header to this request. Duplicate headers are not supported - subsequent calls with the same name will replace the previous call's value. According to the HTTP spec, duplicate headers are allowed only if the combined values are semantically identical to a comma-separated list of the values. If such a thing is needed, you must combine the values manually.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the header (e.g. "Accept")
        value - The value for this header.
        Returns:
        this

      • parameter

        public HTTPRequest parameter(java.lang.String key,
                    java.lang.Object value)
        Add a query string parameter to this request. Duplicates are allowed and order will be preserved. The value will be toString()'d.
        Parameters:
        key -
        value -
        Returns:
        this

      • body

        public HTTPRequest body(java.io.InputStream stream)
        Add a body to this request as an InputStream. Only one body can be added - if multiple are needed, see body(MultipartFormData).
        Parameters:
        stream -
        Returns:
        this

      • body

        public HTTPRequest body(org.codehaus.jackson.JsonNode node)
                 throws HTTPRequestException,
                        org.codehaus.jackson.JsonProcessingException
        Add a JSON body to this request as an JsonNode. Also sets the Content-Type header. Only one body can be added - if multiple are needed, see body(MultipartFormData).
        Parameters:
        node -
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        org.codehaus.jackson.JsonProcessingException - If there's a problem serializing the JsonNode.
        HTTPRequestException - If there's a general IOException in serialization.

      • body

        public HTTPRequest body(Form form)
        Add a application/x-www-form-urlencoded body to this request. Only one body can be added - set multiple bodies inside of formData.
        Parameters:
        form -
        Returns:
        this

      • body

        public HTTPRequest body(MultipartFormData formData)
        Add a multipart/form-data body to this request. Only one body can be added - set multiple bodies inside of formData.
        Parameters:
        formData -
        Returns:
        this

      • body

        public HTTPRequest body(java.lang.Object obj)
        Add an object as a body to this request. Object.toString() will be called on the object, and the resulting String sent over with the configured encoding. Only one body can be added - if multiple are needed, see body(MultipartFormData).
        Parameters:
        obj -
        Returns:
        this

      • setEncoding

        public HTTPRequest setEncoding(java.lang.String value)
        Set the encoding to use for serialization of both query string and body. This should be set before the body if a body is needed. Defaults to UTF-8.
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        this

      • setVerifyCertificates

        public HTTPRequest setVerifyCertificates(boolean value)
        Enable/disable certificate verification. Defaults to true (enabled). This can be useful for development but shouldn't be used in production.
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        this

      • send

        public HTTPResponse send()
                  throws HTTPRequestException
        Send the request and retrieve a response.
        Returns:
        An HTTPResponse object.
        Throws:
        HTTPRequestException - If any IO-related exceptions occur while making this request. The thrown exception will wrap that exception.

      • sendAndVerify

        public HTTPResponse sendAndVerify()
                           throws HTTPRequestException,
                                  HTTPResponseException
        Send the request and throw HTTPResponseException if response.isOk() evaluates to false.
        Returns:
        An HTTPResponse object.
        Throws:
        HTTPRequestException - If any IO-related exceptions occur while making this request. The thrown exception will wrap that exception.
        HTTPResponseException - If the response status is not 20X.

      • createClient

        protected org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient createClient()
        Creates the client to be used for the request. A subclass can override this to return a different type of client to be used, or customize something about the one that would be returned.

      • buildURI

        protected java.net.URI buildURI()
                         throws HTTPRequestException
        Builds the URI to be used for the request. This takes into account query string parameters that might already be part of the user-provided string, and merges those with any configured parameters.
        Throws:
        HTTPRequestException - Wrapping the possible URISyntaxException.

      • buildRequest

        protected org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpUriRequest buildRequest(java.net.URI uri)
        Provides the proper HttpUriRequest implementation for this request. A subclass can override this to return a different type of request.
        Parameters:
        uri - The URI that was built from buildURI().
